title: Registered Nurse Interview
Interview Descriptions: fair interview process for hiring.  Non biased. Interviewed for a handful for positions as a new graduate.  Submitted online. Waited just a few days to hear back from someone. Interviewed in person.

title: Education Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Altru Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a recruiter who asked questions as if they were on a script. No acknowledgement after I answered a question, just moved on to the next question (one of the most robotic-feeling interviews I have ever had). Next step was an interview with the hiring manager followed by an interview with three other team members/colleagues. Position ended up being filled by an internal candidate.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict with a co-worker and how you handled it.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Altru Health
Interview Descriptions: Everything went well during interview but you will feel like that's all lie. The manager said he will help the employee to move on and improve their performance but actually he did not. He literally doesn't know how his team is doing for their job.
Interview Questions:
How was your work before?
What do you think of your weakness in working?
How to deal with the relationship with coworkers and leaders? (Finally you will know how you should deal with it)

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Altru Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first, then video interview. Roughly 30 mins each. It’s kind going well in interview, but after you’re hired they would try their best to picky on you. Like if you’re doing things in the different way, they will say you’re wrong. Lots of blames and talking behind you when you’re working here. Finally, you’ll get discontinued on your job because they find more easy to complain, even bully and cheaper labor than you.
Interview Questions:
What did you do in your last job?
How do you resolve the difficulty situations?
Can you give an example of how did you deal with the relationship with your manager and coworkers?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Altru Health in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I have interviewed for several positions with this company. They seem to ask similar questions every time. The questions focus on a problem, how you solved it, and what the outcome was.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you disagreed with or had a problem with a coworker. How did you solve this problem and what was the outcome?

title: MT/CLS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Altru Health (Grand Forks, ND)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went smoothly. First I did a phone interview with the recruiter, then a second phone Interview with the lab supervisor. Finally I did an in-person peer interview and got a tour of the lab.
Interview Questions: Name a time you used teamwork in your job, or something like that.

title: Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Altru Health in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Lengthy process, strange questions, odd choice of interviewers, confusing steps.  

After several phone conversations, multiple call onsite interviews and delays in hearing back, I tried to reach out for follow-ups and, ultimately, inform them I accepted an outside offer, but to no answer.  The next week, a form email was sent stating many applications were received and they are no longer processing my application.  

This was for a professional level role and I have never experienced such a lack of professional communication and respect.  It's a disappointment to have gone through such a process and travel to have conversations, only to be 'ghosted' by the in-house recruiter.  I wish them well, though hope the team can build from this feedback and provide a better experience for others.  The greater community is too small to leave such impressions when resources are scarce.
Interview Questions: Behavioral based buestions (Tell me about a time when....)

Interview Questions: What exams are you proficient in?

title: Clinical Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Altru Health (Grand Forks, ND) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process moves at a glacial pace. They have specific days they arrange their interviews to be completed, and if your schedule does not allow for those days, they will have to arrange a special date to meet with their interview team. They will interview you in a round robin style with three or more interviewers. It typically takes anywhere from 45 minutes to over 1 hour. The callback and determination length of wait is quite a bit - can be up to three weeks before they make their determination. 

They will call your current employer for employment verification prior to your interview, so be prepared for your current boss to have questions for you. 

Their questions are meant to be answered in three parts: Situation, what steps you personally took, and how was it resolved.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation in which you had to ensure patient and family satisfaction was met. How did you resolve the situation?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Altru Health (Grand Forks, ND) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I have had multiple interviews here, very professional. They communicate the process very well, however the wait time between application ->interview -> offer is very long. I also went through peer interviewing at the time. The process was enjoyable and I was able to meet future coworkers who came prepared with their own questions, and were able to answer questions about the department. It was a fun process.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to this position?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Altru Health (Grand Forks, ND) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: first off, you wait for the interviewer to call your name out. Then you get up walk up to her and in troduce yourself. Firm hand shake is a must. She then walks you in her office and has you take a seat. She then tells you she will ask about 13-15 questions and I answer the best I can. And so I did.

title: COTA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Altru Health (Grand Forks, ND) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Altru takes along time to get back to you after the interview process, didn't get responses from the human resource department or the supervisor who interviewed me for over 2 weeks. May have been on vacation since it was summer.
Interview Questions: what can you bring to the department that know one else can.

title: Financial Information Analyst/Planning Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Altru Health (Grand Forks, ND) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Four years prior to applying for this job, I did an internship in the same division.
I applied for this job online
Received an invitation to interview in person
Interviewed with future supervisor and co-worker which consisted of 7 situation/behavior/outcome questions.
Was offered the job within 5 days
Had to pass a drug screening and background check
Attended a one day orientation
Started job within three weeks of receiving the job offer
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you had to collaborate with a team to achieve a common goal.

title: Dietary Four Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Altru Health (Grand Forks, ND) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It doesn't take long for them to get back to u after submitting an application about 1 week. But after that u go in for the actual interview which is another week or less depending on their availability to get u in. And after the hiring that's what can take the longest I wanted to start as soon as possible so I called the manager a couple times to let him know I was cleared for the drug and health test so it took me about two weeks before I actually started after that. But other employees said it took them a good month or two. So if your persistent like I was there shouldn't be an issue. Along with it depending if they tell u u have the job in the first interview or not. For me they hired me on the spot but there has been other employees that have to come back for another interview or wait a week before they hear back from them if they got the job or not.
Interview Questions: What are your expectations with us here at Altru.
